summary: Individuals may perceive themselves as inadequate despite their consistent efforts and dedication, highlighting a disconnect between self-perception and reality.
Prioritizing family and consistently dedicating time to loved ones can demonstrate strong commitment and care, even if self-doubt persists.
Spending quality time with family can be a significant indicator of good parenting, regardless of perceived shortcomings.
Others may recognize and appreciate qualities and efforts that individuals themselves fail to see, illustrating the difference between external perception and self-perception.
Consistent actions and dedication can reveal true values and priorities, often contradicting one's self-critical beliefs.
